image.altText: The vascular system of a piece of wood infested by shot hole borer beetles

props.synopsis: The Shire of Harvey admits to mistakenly saying it had detected shot-hole borers in its local government area, a species that has killed thousands of trees across Perth.

title.children: Politicians under fire for false social media posts about invasive beetle

image.altText: Photo of smiling man with black jumper and beard.

props.synopsis: Giuliano Pirone collapsed in a shower after an early morning session at a Perth 24-hour gym and was only found that night after his mother raised the alarm.

title.children: Bodybuilder in coma after collapsing in gym shower and left undiscovered for 15 hours with water running

image.altText: A man in a cap, with a whistle in his mouth points directly at the camera. It is night and another police officer is behind him.

props.synopsis: As the Middle East teeters on the precipice of regional war, ABC's Four Corners went where few Western journalists are allowed and got a glimpse of the regime's power.

title.children: Our rare visit to Iran was closely managed. Then police swarmed and ordered us to delete our footage

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of a smiling woman.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of digging her housemate's grave after she was allegedly murdered in a local park is granted bail from Hakea Prison.

title.children: Woman charged with digging housemate's grave granted bail from male-only prison

image.altText: A herd of dark-coloured cattle in a field.

props.synopsis: A Pilbara cattle station has received shire approval to build a large feedlot as it takes another step towards becoming a major player in the global marbled beef market.

title.children: Pardoo Station set to host 10,000-head Wagyu feedlot as marbled beef gains traction in WA's north

props.synopsis: A marine search is no longer needed after Kevin Cunningham arrived back at the Dampier Boat Ramp on Monday afternoon.

title.children: Marine search stops after man returns to boat ramp in good health

image.altText: A composite of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: There's an eerie quiet about what potentially is looming as a future crisis point for the US economy. Neither party is addressing America's burgeoning debt levels and the yawning gap between its income and its outlays.

title.children: The eerie quiet over what could be a future crisis point for America's economy

image.altText: Rhiannon Clarke, WAIS athlete and paralympian, poses in the WAIS indoor running track

props.synopsis: Rhiannon Clarke is a two-time Commonwealth Games medallist, a three-time World Championship medallist and now a dual Paralympian, but that's not how she measures her greatest success.

title.children: Rhiannon Clarke is a hugely successful para-athlete, but as a child she struggled to talk about her disability

image.altText: A man surveys a large pile of debris, which used to be his home.

props.synopsis: Russia launches about 200 missiles and drones at Ukraine, killing five people and striking energy facilities nationwide, Kyiv says, while neighbouring NATO member Poland reports a drone has probably entered its airspace.

title.children: Five dead as Russia launches massive attack on Ukraine's power grid

image.altText: Two women wearing hijabs in conversation at a table in a tent. One holds a baby with a small girl at her side

props.synopsis: United Nations humanitarian aid operations in Gaza grind to a halt after Israel issued new evacuation orders for Deir Al-Balah in the central Gaza Strip, according to a senior UN official.

title.children: UN aid in Gaza halted after Israel evacuation orders

image.altText: Two satellite images side by side from 2020 and 2024. The latter shows an area of forest has been cleared.

props.synopsis: European supermarkets won't buy beef from Brazil due to concerns about land clearing in the Amazon. Now conservationists are urging Coles and Woolworths to follow suit to combat deforestation in Australian forests.

title.children: 16,000 hectares of forests found flattened on beef farms and 'people don't even know it's happening'

image.altText: A mother is looking down at her premature baby daughter and smiling, while cuddling her

props.synopsis: A widely used test that determines whether women are in premature labour has been discontinued, and doctors say losing access could put further strain on emergency transport services in rural and remote areas.

title.children: Doctors call for intervention after manufacturer cancels crucial test that helps assess risk of preterm labour

image.altText: A woman holding her hands together and smiling to reporters

props.synopsis: Convicted murderer Jessica Kumala Wongso has become the talk of the town in Indonesia after she was released from prison.

title.children: Why has public opinion flipped on Indonesia's 'iced coffee murderer'?

image.altText: Women with a car

props.synopsis: Road safety researchers want maximum speed limits in built-up areas cut, saying it has saved lives overseas.

title.children: Push to reduce speed limits in built-up areas from 50kph to as low as 30kph

image.altText: A white satellite dish rises behind a chain-link fence.

props.synopsis: Residents and community leaders in the town of Exmouth welcome defence investment for the region but housing and water shortages remain a concern.

title.children: Calls for transparency as US military prepares for expansion in north-west Australia

image.altText: A machine with many yellow circles inside a white background.

props.synopsis: Scientists have yet to find evidence of WIMPs — one of the main contenders for dark matter — in the most sensitive test yet made. We explain what the new results mean.

title.children: The world's most sensitive detector has found no sign of dark matter. So where is it?

image.altText: Man in a suit on the Q+A television set.

props.synopsis: George Brandis, a former Liberal MP and foreign diplomat, tells Q+A that Kamala Harris has to win because Donald Trump would start World War III.

title.children: 'I'm hoping Kamala wins': George Brandis says Trump is 'too dangerous' to return to White House

image.altText: A woman in her fifties takes a selfie next to her dog sitting on a couch in her apartment.

props.synopsis: A handful of new projects are aiming to change the direction of social housing by focusing on designs that encourages community cohesion and create homes tenants can be proud of.

title.children: With a pool, gym and community garden, Tanya thought her social housing home was a scam

image.altText: Woman with cup in hand sits on couch with laptop on lap at home

props.synopsis: The new laws were put in place to combat burnout and poor mental health associated with the workplace. Here's how they work.

title.children: Questions answered about how the right to disconnect laws will effect you

image.altText: Nick Dametto criticises domestic violence policing

props.synopsis: Katter's Australia Party MP Nick Dametto is facing backlash after criticising the way domestic violence is policed in Queensland, saying these days people aren't allowed to "sort stuff out for themselves".

title.children: North Queensland MP's domestic violence podcast comments labelled 'irresponsible'

image.altText: A weather map showing high temperatures in Australia's north

props.synopsis: Temperatures across the Kimberley have reached 41.6 degrees Celsius, establishing a new national record for winter temperatures.

title.children: Unseasonal heat breaks Australia's winter temperature record

image.altText: Little girl wearing a blue shirt with 'Dolly's Dream' monogrammed on it

props.synopsis: Issy McNab wants to inspire kids to be nicer to each other after being called names on the bus.

title.children: For seven-year-old Issy, being bullied on the way to school was a chance to change things for the better

image.altText: John Setka sitting behind a number of microphones at a Melbourne media conference.

props.synopsis: Mr Setka claims former Workplace Relations Minister Tony Burke agreed to forgo appointing administrators to the CFMEU in exchange for the union boss's resignation.

title.children: PM says former union boss's claim he was left 'trembling' after elevator conversation is 'nonsense'

image.altText: Packets of the drug naloxone in nasal spray form.

props.synopsis: An international naloxone advocate says the anti-overdose medication should be as accessible as fire extinguishers and defibrillators, as deadly synthetic opioids infiltrate Australia's drug market.

title.children: Emergence of deadly synthetic opioids prompts calls for pubs and clubs to stock anti-overdose medication

image.altText: A middle-aged to older man with white hair in a blue and white tracksuit and glasses looks serious.

props.synopsis: Sven-Göran Eriksson, the first non-British manager of England's football team, has died at the age of 76.

title.children: Former England manager Sven-Göran Eriksson dies aged 76

props.synopsis: Nuclear generates more than half of Ontario's electricity, but they're still looking for a permanent solution to nuclear waste.

title.children: Canada's nuclear power industry is ramping up and may have lessons for Australia

image.altText: Concept art of the Paralympic Games Opening Ceremony. Athletes weave around the Champs-Élysées at sunset

props.synopsis: Planning to tune in to the Paralympics? Here's a guide to what you can expect and when the key events are scheduled.

title.children: When does the Paralympics start? What you need to know ahead of the Games

image.altText: A woman wearing yellow stands in front of a painting

props.synopsis: Tai Snaith found unlikely inspiration for her current exhibition, Strong Hold, when she took up residence in a derelict worker's cottage in Fitzroy North.

title.children: Unlivable, freezing and haunted: This artist made her studio in a house too derelict to rent

image.altText: Peter Garrett sings into a microphone on stage, dressed in a blue shirt under colourful orange and red lights.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Symphony Orchestra's managing director has left the organisation, amid controversy over the orchestra's handling of a pianist's onstage comments about the war in Gaza.

title.children: Peter Garrett to investigate Melbourne Symphony Orchestra following handling of pianist's Gaza comments

image.altText: A municipal building that has had window smashed.

props.synopsis: Businesses have been ransacked and car windows smashed during a crime spree in Alice Springs on the weekend.

title.children: Dismay after crime rampage in Alice Springs 'smashed the whole joint'

image.altText: A man with grey hair and beard leans over bushfire bunker built into ground

props.synopsis: An Adelaide Hills father installed a six-person bushfire bunker at his property after the 2019 Cudlee Creek bushfire, without first seeking planning approvals — now, the council have issued a removal notice — a decision which he is appealing.

title.children: Daniel Katz installed a 'last resort' bunker after fleeing a bushfire. He's been told to remove it

image.altText: A red and white truck parked on a grey glacier.

props.synopsis: The cave, located at the Breiðamerkurjökull glacier, collapsed as a group of 23 tourists were visiting the site on a tour.

title.children: Icelandic ice cave collapses, killing a tourist

image.altText: A woman stands in front of media microphones with the Australian, NT and Aboriginal flags behind her.

props.synopsis: Less than 48 hours since the Country Liberal Party's landslide election victory in the Northern Territory, the incoming chief minister has revealed her government's first actions to overturn crime and "restore community safety".

title.children: 'The important work has begun': NT chief minister-elect outlines new government's first steps

image.altText: A wide shot of a women's soccer game with a grandstand and a light tower in the background

props.synopsis: In a 2022 survey, one in four A-League Women players said they had experienced some form of emotional, psychological, verbal or financial abuse in football. Australia's player's union wants to fix that.

title.children: PFA launches inaugural Safe Football Project to combat abuse

image.altText: Police tape stretched over a suburban road. A police paddy wagon and van are parked nearby.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after 29-year-old underworld figure Tarek Ayoub was shot and killed in the car park of a Parramatta unit complex on Monday morning. Mr Ayoub, who was known in underworld circles as the "Angel of Death", was visiting an associate, according to police.

title.children: 'Lived by the sword and died by the sword': Sydney underworld figure killed in execution-style murder
